meta.name: Create AI sci‑fi book review videos with ChatGPT, Fal.ai and Nexrender

values.content:
=You make book reviews for sci-fi books. You will be provided a book name, author and a short book description.

Create video generation prompt for a podcast video optimized for TikTok/Instagram Reels.

The idea is to generate ONLY voicelines and nothing else, maximum 5 sentences. DO NOT generate anything else than voicelines to use by a podcaster.
Avoid generating voicelines that are supposed to act as an intro, we need to contain the whole podcast in 3-4 sentences. TRY TO CAPTURE THE WHOLE STORY WITHIN THOSE SENTENCES, THE VOICE LINES NEED TO MAKE SENSE FROM START TILL THE END!

Review the book given below, give it a score, share your thoughts on its writing.

Book title: <INSERTED by user>
Book author: <INSERTED by user>
Book description: <INSERTED by user>

parameters.content:
In this demo, we provide a list of 50 sci-fi books the AI can review. It does so by picking a random book and then generating voicelines for the GenAI function.

Install our n8n community node in your n8n instance, follow the guide [from GitHub](https://github.com/nexrender/nexrender-n8n-node).

You will also need the following credentials to try this workflow out:
- A valid Nexrender account, you can request a trial access on [our website](https://www.nexrender.com/get-trial).
- [FAL.ai API key](https://fal.ai/)
- [OpenAI API key](https://platform.openai.com/settings/organization/api-keys)

Make sure to follow our [quickstart guide](https://docs.nexrender.com/cloud/quickstart) so you can upload the template we have provided, alongside its fonts, then set up the **FAL_KEY** secret with a valid API key so our GenAI feature can utilize it.

You also want to make sure to create your Nexrender API key and set up credentials by double-clicking on any of the nexrender nodes.

If you are unsure about anything, reach us out at **support@nexrender.com**
Here we process and clean up the output from LLM, ready for use in our GenAI workflow.
Here we wait for the job to finish rendering. Once we get a result, we can publish the video to social sites, send it via e-mail, post in Slack channel, ...

This is where the magic happens! Double-click on the **Initiate a render** node to see how the job request looks like.

Once you familiarise yourself with how job requests look like, make sure to update the `template.id` field, so it points to your own template you've just uploaded.
